> My biggest frustration is the AI, obviously. My team members attack 
anything, regardless of level, virtually ignore yell and protect 
orders, and scatter themselves everywhere. 

I agree.  I had to use "yo" repeatedly during "the Slime King" just to 
get to the point of reaching the opponent slime.  Honestly, at times, 
I really wish I could turn off my team's x-ray vision.

>It's extraordinarily hard to make them act as a unit, unless I play 
at slow speeds and alternate between each character, dragging each
 one out of danger in turn.

The easiest times I had with "Tic and Tac" were on those rare 
occassions when my team acted like a team.

>At this level of AI, it's easiest to play a team of one.

Hehe, it's almost mission impossible to complete "Yet Even More 
Hedges" with a one man team because of all the faeries.

I can play with a team of 5, but I have to stop every 30 seconds or so 
to access the menu to see how the rest of my team's health is.

It's really frustrating because during my hedge scenarios, either I 
controlled my elf or my elf gets killed.

That's one of the reasons I really like the idea of being able to 
choose which members of your team complete each scenario.  That way I 
could have the benefits of large teams and small teams.  If I put a 
thief and an elf on the same time and go through a scneario with lots 
of forested areas, I would hope my thief wouldn't kill the rest of the 
team while I navigate the elf through the scenario.
